channel.title: Best HL1 version to start with
channel.description:
Hi all,
I'm one of those lurkers who has been tracking Black Mesa for a while and finally got impatient and decided to have a look at one of the old nasty looking HL1 games.
Basically i started with HL2, got hooked, and played through the episode instalments after that and now want to go back to the original to experience how it all begins. I've done a bit of research into the original vs original with HD pack vs HL: source arguments, and basically haven't been able to decide for myself which of these will leave the best 'first' impression.
Because i've started with more recent versions of the game I think i want the version with the best graphics (and fewest glitches) without substantially compromising the authenticity of the game. Which version of HL1 should i get?
note: the game are old enough now that the price difference between them isn't a factor. I also don't care about online multilayer, editing or recording capabilities. I just want the best version of the game from a story mode perspective.
Cheers.

item.title: Best HL1 version to start with
item.dc:creator: Dadster
item.description:
Try HL-Source Enhanced, current rev. 874. Info is available at the moddb website. It installs as a standalone mod on its own, separate from Steam. The mod creator has already incorporated numerous skin and model mods from well known modders from the HL community, sort of the “best of the best”. I’m playing it now without any problems.
Besides better water textures, you also get shadows, better sparks, better explosions. It certainly is far superior to the original HL.
